benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Retrieve invoice item custom fields

covered: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios validate 200 responses and correct data for valid invoiceItemId (TC01–TC05, TC12).
Empty Response: Explicitly covered with an invoice item that has no custom fields returning an empty array (TC04).
Query Parameters: Audit enum covered for NONE (default), FULL, MINIMAL, plus invalid audit value and unsupported extra params (TC01–TC05, TC11, TC19).
Authorization: Unauthorized request returning 401 is tested (TC08).
Input Validation: Invalid UUID format and non-existent resource produce 400/404 per story (TC06, TC07, TC17).
Resilience/Errors: Service/database unavailable (503), dependency failure (503), and timeout (504) are exercised (TC09, TC16, TC20).
Security Hardening: Injection/XSS inputs are rejected (TC10, TC21).
Performance/Concurrency: Large volume, parallel requests, and response time expectations are addressed (TC12, TC15).
Backward compatibility: Older Accept header behavior considered (TC14).
gaps: Pagination: No scenario verifies pagination or explicitly asserts the endpoint is unpaginated; TC12 tests large volume but not paging behavior.
Caching Behavior: No checks for Cache-Control/ETag headers or conditional requests (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since).
Rate Limiting: No scenarios for throttling/429 Too Many Requests under burst traffic.
Content-Type/Produces: No explicit assertion of Content-Type: application/json for success and error responses.
Schema Validation: No validation that each CustomField object conforms to the contract (required fields, types, enum values).

Audit Semantics Consistency: TC01 expects default NONE audit info present, while TC13 expects no audit info unless explicitly set; this is inconsistent and may contradict the story’s default behavior.
Authorization Depth: No scenario for authenticated but unauthorized/forbidden (403) access if RBAC applies.
Server Error Handling: No generic 500 Internal Server Error scenario for unexpected failures.

Parameter Robustness: No tests for case sensitivity/whitespace in audit (e.g., full, Full, spaces) or multiple audit params; no explicit test that unknown pagination params are ignored if not supported.
Response Determinism: No assertion for stable ordering or uniqueness of returned custom fields if applicable.
recommendations: Add a scenario to verify pagination behavior: either validate paging params (page/size/next) if supported or assert that providing paging params is ignored/400 if unsupported. Include large dataset assertions across pages if applicable.
Introduce caching tests: assert Cache-Control and ETag headers on 200; add conditional GET with If-None-Match leading to 304 Not Modified.
Add rate limiting tests: send burst of requests to trigger/verify 429 Too Many Requests, and verify Retry-After header.
Assert response headers: Content-Type: application/json on success and error; charset if applicable.
Add JSON schema validation for CustomField objects (required fields, types, enum constraints) and for audit sections per level (NONE/MINIMAL/FULL).
Resolve audit default behavior and align TC01/TC13: either expect explicit absence of audit data when not set (per TC13) or presence at NONE level (per TC01). Keep one consistent with API contract.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated user lacking permissions (if RBAC applies), ensuring correct error body.
Include a generic 500 Internal Server Error test path to validate error envelope and headers.
Expand query parameter robustness: test audit case sensitivity, leading/trailing spaces, duplicate audit params, and ensure unknown params are ignored or rejected per spec.
If ordering is defined, add an assertion for deterministic ordering (e.g., by createdDate or name); otherwise, document that order is undefined and avoid order-dependent assertions.
